snippet: The day may come when a candidate’s hologram could appear in your kitchen and talk about education issues.
abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column laments that 21st century technology has done little to improve the way presidents communicate with citizens, noting Pres Obama's latest run of tired photo-ops, rallies and fundraisers; imagines future use of holograms in presidential outreach; contends that while Obama's handlers would like to paint image of him as a man of the people trying to make real change, his latest travels seem like a mere escape from a hostile and intransigent Congress back in Washington.
lead_paragraph: The day may come when a candidate’s hologram could appear in your kitchen and talk about education issues.
